Tucson transforms into robot mode and quietly sighs.

" I have made many mi=
stakes.  Yes allowing Straight Shot to stick up for herself looked wrong an=
d you are right to question that.  But why should it be wrong to defend one=
 self against harassing ridicule?  I would not have stood for her behavior =
if I did not see a cause for her displeasure.  Master Yokitron would always=
 remind me that discipline had to come from the victim of wrong doing rathe=
r than outside reprimand in order to work effectively.  To you and others m=
y methods are untraditional, and that is valid cause for concern.  Leo I am=
 not like everyone else.  Even as an Autobot I was considered a somewhat re=
negade of the faction.  I thought well off the pavement.  And I have a very=
 unpredictable reputation.  I have not lost that reputation Leo Prime.  And=
 I am no means perfect.  And if revoking my leadership is what they are her=
e to do then they have every right to do so.  I am not the average Maximal =
AKA Autobot.  I am too much of a rebel and I do best on my own accord.  

H=
e was ready for consequences as he waits for Leo's reaction.

Perpetually o=
n the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 22, 2011, at 5:48 PM, Super Cyclon=
us <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson meets Leo Pri=
me's expression with an angry stare of his own. His
> > tail continues to s=
nap in an agitated manner yet he doesn't lash out in full
> > draconic fury=
, as it would seem.
> >
> > " I seriously hope you are not intending to und=
ermine me Leo. "
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> LEO PRIME carefully said nothing as he wai=
ted for everyone to leave
> the room. He glanced over and saw QUICKSTRIDE c=
oming in to check in on
> UPROAR. With a deft movement LEO pushed a button =
closing off the side
> of the medbay he was on from the side that QUICKSTRI=
DE and UPROAR were
> on, and then darkned the lgass for privacy. If QUICKST=
RIDE wanted to
> leave there was a secondary door for that.
> 
> Finally LE=
O turned to TUSCON as he folded his arms behind his back.
> TUSCON was larg=
er than LEO, and yet there was no fear in LEO's optics
> as he carefully ex=
amined him, noting the changes that have occured
> because of his new beast=
 mode.
> 
> "Undermine you?" LEO PRIME said finally, his voice neutral and =
yet a
> curious lilt to it. "You allowed your subordinates, your family as =
you
> say, to intentionally try to harm another Maximal or Autobot." He
> p=
aused as he shifted his gaze to the map of the jungle scene for a
> moment.=
 "Under normal circumstances that would be automatic
> disciplinary action.=
 An assault on a fellow soldier and you allowed
> it?"
> 
> While LEO PRIME=
's voice was low, there was a controlled power in it,
> an anger of his own=
 held in powerful check. "The council has not sent
> a single mech to ancie=
nt Earth in years, and now all of a sudden you
> get nine?" He tilted his h=
ead as he watched for changes in expression,
> "Have you any idea why that =
might be?"
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson transforms into robot mode and =
quietly sighs.</div><div><br></div><div>" I have made many mistakes.  =
Yes allowing Straight Shot to stick up for herself looked wrong and you are=
 right to question that.  But why should it be wrong to defend one sel=
f against harassing ridicule?  I would not have stood for her behavior=
 if I did not see a cause for her displeasure.  Master Yokitron would =
always remind me that discipline had to come from the victim of wrong doing=
 rather than outside reprimand in order to work effectively.  To you a=
nd others my methods are untraditional, and that is valid cause for concern=
.  Leo I am not like everyone else.  Even as an Autobot I was con=
sidered a somewhat renegade of the faction.  I thought well off the pa=
vement.  And I have a very unpredictable reputation.  I have not =
lost that reputation Leo Prime.  And I am no means perfect.  And =
if revoking my leadership is what they are here to do then they have every =
right to do so.  I am not the average Maximal AKA Autobot.  I am =
too much of a rebel and I do best on my own accord.  </div><div><br></=
div><div>He was ready for consequences as he waits for Leo's reaction.<br><=
br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. </div><div><br>On Aug =
22, 2011, at 5:48 PM, Super Cyclonus <<a href=3D"mailto:supercyclonus@gm=
ail.com">supercyclonus@...</a>> wrote:<br><br></div><div></div><bl=
ockquote type=3D"cite"><div>




<span style=3D"display:none"> </span>=




    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>> <OLD><br>
=
><br>
> Tucson meets Leo Prime's expression with an angry stare of hi=
s own.  His<br>
> tail continues to snap in an agitated manner yet he do=
esn't lash out in full<br>
> draconic fury, as it would seem.<br>
><b=
r>
> " I seriously hope you are not intending to undermine me Leo. "<br>=

<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
LEO PRIME carefully said nothing as he waited fo=
r everyone to leave<br>
the room. He glanced over and saw QUICKSTRIDE comin=
g in to check in on<br>
UPROAR. With a deft movement LEO pushed a button cl=
osing off the side<br>
of the medbay he was on from the side that QUICKSTRI=
DE and UPROAR were<br>
on, and then darkned the lgass for privacy. If QUICK=
STRIDE wanted to<br>
leave there was a secondary door for that.<br>
<br>
Fi=
nally LEO turned to TUSCON as he folded his arms behind his back.<br>
TUSCO=
N was larger than LEO, and yet there was no fear in LEO's optics<br>
as he =
carefully examined him, noting the changes that have occured<br>
because of=
 his new beast mode.<br>
<br>
"Undermine you?" LEO PRIME said finally, his =
voice neutral and yet a<br>
curious lilt to it. "You allowed your subordina=
tes, your family as you<br>
say, to intentionally try to harm another Maxim=
al or Autobot." He<br>
paused as he shifted his gaze to the map of the jung=
le scene for a<br>
moment. "Under normal circumstances that would be automa=
tic<br>
disciplinary action. An assault on a fellow soldier and you allowed=
<br>
it?"<br>
<br>
While LEO PRIME's voice was low, there was a controlled =
power in it,<br>
an anger of his own held in powerful check. "The council h=
as not sent<br>
a single mech to ancient Earth in years, and now all of a s=
udden you<br>
get nine?" He tilted his head as he watched for changes in ex=
pression,<br>
"Have you any idea why that might be?"<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br=
>
Preston<br>
</p>
